title: Volume of H2O to take HNO3 from pH 4.20 to 5.20

content.question: At <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, enough distilled water is added to a <math alttext="30.0 milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="H N O 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HN</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with a <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="4.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> so that the final <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the diluted solution is <math alttext="5.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The volume of distilled water added to the original solution is closest to

choices.label: <math alttext="270 decimal point milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>270.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="300 decimal point milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="270 decimal point milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>270.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
